<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_close:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_close(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				struct linux_device *ldev)
{
	(void)lbus;
	unsigned int i;

	for (i = 0; i < ldev->device.num_regions; i++) {
		metal_unmap(ldev->device.regions[i].virt,
			    ldev->device.regions[i].size);
	}
	if (ldev->override) {
		sysfs_write_attribute(ldev->override, "", 1);
		ldev->override = NULL;
	}
	if (ldev->sdev) {
		sysfs_close_device(ldev->sdev);
		ldev->sdev = NULL;
	}
	if (ldev->fd >= 0) {
		close(ldev->fd);
	}
}
```
</target_code>

Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.

scenario: The loop body (metal_unmap call) is executed for each i in 0 .. ldev->device.num_regions-1, so it is reachable whenever ldev->device.num_regions > 0. If num_regions is 0 the loop is simply not entered (this is not "unreachable code" under MISRA 2.1). There is no evidence in the provided fragment that the loop body can never be executed, so Rule 2.1 is not violated.
